articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on Wednesday reached the Northern Mariana Islands, where he is expected to plead guilty to violating U.S. espionage law that will set him free and allow him return home to Australia.
articles.title: WikiLeaks' Assange arrives in Mariana Islands for US plea deal

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: NATO on Wednesday selected Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte as NATO's next boss, as the war in Ukraine rages on its doorstep and uncertainty hangs over the United States' future attitude to the transatlantic alliance.
articles.title: NATO picks Netherlands' Mark Rutte as next boss

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded several areas across Gaza on Wednesday, and residents reported fierce fighting overnight in Rafah in the south of the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Israeli forces pound north and south Gaza, battle Hamas in Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Reporters were briefly allowed to film U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich on Wednesday before the start of his trial in the Russian city of Yekaterinburg on charges of espionage that he denies.
articles.title: Gershkovich appears with shaved head before start of closed trial in Russia

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Aziz Taher, Hassan Hankir
articles.description: Ahmed Abu Della was born in the Lebanese village of Yarine before the land to the south was known as Israel.
articles.title: Displaced yet again, southern Lebanese decry lack of state support

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: Protesters vowed to keep up demonstrations against new tax hikes a day after police opened fire on crowds trying to storm parliament, killing at least five people and wounding dozens.
articles.title: Kenyan protesters promise more rallies

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: Judges at the International Criminal Court (ICC) convicted a Malian Islamist on Wednesday of war crimes and crimes against humanity for being a central figure in the Islamic police that flogged residents of Timbuktu during a 2012 rebel takeover.
articles.title: ICC convicts Mali Islamist for Timbuktu atrocities

articles.author: Angelo Amante
articles.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni criticised on Wednesday plans to share out the top jobs in EU institutions, saying they ignored the wishes voters had expressed during elections earlier this month for the European Parliament.
articles.title: Italy's Meloni says EU top jobs deal ignores voters' wishes

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez will be ordered to spend decades in prison when a U.S. judge sentences him later on Wednesday for his conviction on drug and firearm offenses.
articles.title: Honduras ex-President Hernandez faces long prison term after US drug conviction

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Heavy rainfall triggered landslides and flash floods in Nepal, killing at least 11 people, with another nine killed by lightning strikes over the past two days, officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Heavy rains in Nepal kill 20 in two days amid landslides, lightning strikes
